metadata.scoring_methodology: 4-dimensional analysis with confidence capping for sequential work
metadata.confidence_cap_reason: Sequential work detected - systematic uncertainty for unverified coordination

informative_value.description: How useful and accurate is the information provided

prescriptive_risk.description: Risk of documentation prescribing wrong or outdated approaches

confidence_score.description: Confidence in accuracy and currentness of content
confidence_score.note: Sequential work capped at 55 due to lack of coordination verification

relevance_score.description: Relevance to actual system usage and user needs

classification_categories.SAFE: High confidence, low risk, verified accurate or user-created
classification_categories.CAUTIONARY: Moderate confidence, potential prescriptive issues, needs review
classification_categories.EXCLUDE: Low confidence, high risk, outdated or unverified claims
classification_categories.READ-ONLY: External agent work - reference only, do not modify

files.title: Documentation
files.rationale: Navigation-focused, accurate Diátaxis framework implementation, user-facing, no prescriptive content

files.title: Adaptive Pivot Protocol
files.rationale: Design pattern documented but implementation pending. Prescribes confidence monitoring not yet built. Good concept, unverified execution.
concerns: Says 'implementation pending' but documented as usable pattern
Confidence monitoring code examples are theoretical
No evidence of actual usage or testing

files.title: Understanding the System
files.rationale: Navigation doc, purely informational, accurate Diátaxis categorization

files.title: File Routing Explained
files.rationale: Explains actual system behavior, verified through usage, minimal prescriptive risk

files.title: Hive-Mind System Overview
files.rationale: Good overview but makes claims about features that may be aspirational. Database size claims need verification. Queen selection guidance reasonable but unverified.
concerns: Queen type recommendations may be theoretical
Performance claims (10-20x speedup) lack local verification

files.title: Session Management Explained
files.rationale: Explains core system behavior accurately, matches implementation, high user value

files.title: Workspace Architecture Explained
files.rationale: Excellent explanation of stock vs custom, accurate percentages, honest about trade-offs

files.title: Claude Flow Documentation
files.rationale: Legacy file from pre-integration, superseded by current docs, marked outdated by name
files.recommendation: ARCHIVE - Superseded by docs/README.md and current structure

files.title: How to Choose the Right Coordination Approach
files.rationale: Useful decision framework but makes unverified claims about hive-mind usage patterns. Decision tree is logical but based on theoretical scenarios.
concerns: Claims 'Current Usage: Nearly zero' - needs verification

files.title: Claude Flow Integration Testing Guide
files.rationale: Verified through actual testing, 100% pass rate documented, session-based evidence

files.title: How to Operate Your AI Workspace
files.rationale: Operational guidance but likely contains unverified workflows. Needs testing validation.

files.title: Zero-Risk Execution Pattern for Hive-Mind
files.rationale: Prescribes detailed execution pattern that may not match actual hive-mind behavior. Good safety concept but unverified procedures.
concerns: HITL approval gates may not align with actual implementation

files.title: System Internals Documentation
files.rationale: Navigation for internals, reasonable categorization

files.title: Architecture Overview
files.rationale: Technical deep-dive but sequential creation raises verification concerns. Architecture diagrams likely accurate but interaction patterns unverified.

files.title: Coordination Mechanics
files.rationale: Explains coordination but likely based on intended behavior vs tested reality. Sequential creation without agent verification.

files.title: Data Flow
files.rationale: Data flow diagrams useful but need verification against actual system behavior

files.title: Hooks and Automation
files.rationale: Hooks are well-tested via integration testing guide. Automation claims may need verification but hooks behavior documented.

files.title: Integration Points
files.rationale: Integration points likely documented but sequential creation raises accuracy concerns

files.title: Memory Architecture
files.rationale: Memory system tested and verified. Architecture likely accurate based on integration testing.
files.evidence: Memory operations verified in integration testing

files.title: Operational Architecture: User-System Interaction Model
files.rationale: User interaction model likely theoretical. Largest internals doc suggests comprehensive but unverified content.

files.title: Session Lifecycle
files.rationale: Session lifecycle observable and testable. Likely accurate based on actual session usage patterns.

files.title: Stock vs Custom
files.rationale: Critical analysis, honest assessment, verifiable claims about stock vs custom components

files.title: Stock Claude-Flow Protocol for `.claude-flow` Directories
files.rationale: Documents stock protocol but workspace uses custom session structure. Potential confusion.
concerns: May mislead users about actual structure

files.title: Hive Mind: What Actually Works
files.rationale: CRITICAL DOCUMENT - Honest assessment of what's real vs aspirational. Reality score 65/100 acknowledged. Transparent about gaps.
files.note: This document is gold - it corrects aspirational claims in other docs

files.title: Claude Flow Feature Verification Checklist
files.rationale: Verified through testing, actionable checklist, accurate expectations

files.title: Hive-Mind Quick Reference
files.rationale: Quick reference useful but may include aspirational commands. Needs verification against actual CLI.

files.title: Hive Mind Reality Guide
files.rationale: CRITICAL DOCUMENT - Based on actual testing, honest about limitations, reality score 65/100 documented
files.note: Companion to feature-reality-check.md - both are essential truth-tellers

files.title: Implementation Architecture: Session Management Complete Solution
files.rationale: Detailed implementation but unverified. May describe intended vs actual implementation.

files.title: Hive Mind Template Library - Usage Guide
files.rationale: Template library may not exist or match documented structure. High prescriptive risk if users follow non-existent patterns.

files.title: Claude Flow Troubleshooting Guide
files.rationale: Troubleshooting based on real issues encountered. Connected to integration testing. Practical solutions.

files.title: Welcome to Your Claude-Flow Workspace
files.rationale: Good orientation but promises learning paths that may not be fully implemented. Time commitments not verified.

files.rationale: Foundation tutorials organized but content accuracy unknown. Sequential creation without testing.

files.rationale: Advanced phase with highest risk of aspirational content. 'Mastery' implies capabilities that may not exist.

files.title: Adaptive Topology
files.rationale: Adaptive topology may be theoretical feature. High prescriptive risk if users expect automation.

files.title: Byzantine Consensus
files.rationale: Byzantine consensus tutorial but actual implementation and reliability unverified

files.title: Hive-Mind Coordination
files.rationale: Advanced coordination tutorial but reality guide shows 65% readiness. Tutorial may oversell capabilities.

files.title: ReasoningBank Learning
files.rationale: ReasoningBank infrastructure exists but has 0 trajectories. Tutorial teaches feature that isn't active. High risk.
concerns: Tutorial promises learning that hasn't been validated
Users may expect functionality that doesn't work
files.recommendation: MARK AS EXPERIMENTAL or REMOVE until feature is validated

files.title: Tutorials
files.rationale: Navigation and overview. Honest about tutorial status and alternatives.

files.title: Learning Progress Tracker
files.rationale: Progress tracker for tutorial sequence but tutorial quality unverified

tutorial_quality.foundations: Generally SAFE (70-80% scores) - Basic verified features
tutorial_quality.essential_skills: Mixed SAFE/CAUTIONARY (65-85% scores) - Some unverified patterns
tutorial_quality.intermediate: Mostly CAUTIONARY (54-65% scores) - Advanced features less verified
tutorial_quality.advanced: HIGH RISK (40-56% scores) - Aspirational content, unverified claims

immediate_actions.action: Mark reasoning-bank.md as EXPERIMENTAL or archive
immediate_actions.rationale: Feature has 0 episodes, tutorial misleads users
Superseded by current structure, marked legacy

immediate_actions.action: Add 'UNVERIFIED' warnings to all CAUTIONARY tutorials

immediate_actions.rationale: These correct aspirational claims in other docs

immediate_actions.action: Verify advanced tutorial claims through actual usage
immediate_actions.rationale: Byzantine consensus, adaptive topology need validation

refactoring_strategy.keep_as_is: 18 SAFE docs - verified or low-risk informational
refactoring_strategy.archive_or_mark_experimental: 1 EXCLUDE doc - misleading or inactive features
prioritize_updates: Advanced tutorials (Phase 4) - highest aspiration vs reality gap
Hive-mind coordination docs - verify against actual behavior
Template and workflow docs - confirm patterns exist and work

documentation_gaps.aspirational_vs_reality: Reality guides exist but aren't prominent enough
documentation_gaps.user_confusion_risk: Tutorial progression promises features that may not work as described

methodology_notes.confidence_capping: All sequentially-created docs capped at 55 confidence due to lack of agent coordination and testing verification
methodology_notes.evidence_based_scoring: Docs linked to testing sessions (integration-testing-guide) scored higher
methodology_notes.reality_check_bonus: Docs that acknowledge limitations (reality guides) scored higher for honesty
methodology_notes.prescriptive_risk_calculation: Higher risk for docs that prescribe specific workflows vs explain concepts
methodology_notes.tutorial_penalty: Advanced tutorials scored lower due to higher likelihood of aspirational content
